Supervisor: Prof. R. Tom Baker Thesis: Design, Synthesis and Characterization of New Inorganic Base Metal Catalysts for the Aerobic Oxidation of Lignin Models and Lignin Extracts.
Bachelor of Science in Chemistry - 2009 Universidad de Chile
Research Supervisor: Prof. Claudio Olea-Azar Thesis: Biological and Chemical Study of Tetracyclic Nitroindazole with Important Antiparasite Effects.

Position: Senior Research Engineer

Tasks: Responsible for planning,  CANDIDATE 		Christian Díaz-Urrutia
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:		Belgium – Brussels
QUALIFICATIONS
PhD Chemistry - 2016 University of Ottawa Research
Supervisor: Prof. R. Tom Baker Thesis: Design, Synthesis and Characterization of New Inorganic Base Metal Catalysts for the Aerobic Oxidation of Lignin Models and Lignin Extracts.
Bachelor of Science in Chemistry - 2009 Universidad de Chile
Research Supervisor: Prof. Claudio Olea-Azar Thesis: Biological and Chemical Study of Tetracyclic Nitroindazole with Important Antiparasite Effects.
Languages
Spanish – fluent
English – fluent
CAREER SUMMARY
August 2019 to date ExxonMobil, Global Research; Brussels, Belgium
January 2022 to date
Position: Senior Research Engineer
August 2019 to December 2021
Research Engineer
Tasks: Responsible for planning, managing and executing all aspects of research and process development projects. Specifically, conducting fundamental and applied research on heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysts, adsorbents, and catalytic processes, such as new chemical transformation to upgrade hydrocarbon feedstocks. He is a member of research teams that span multiple regions (Americas, EU, Asia) that are composed of interdisciplinary members (chemists, engineers, business, marketing). As an example of a research project, please see press release https://lnkd.in/euz-9hAP (catalyst and process development for propane dehydrogenation technologies).
Other tasks include: managing a group of approx. seven research technicians (MSc, BSc) on laboratory experimentation, spectroscopy and chromatography data collection, troubleshooting and SHE related training. Responsible for purchases of equipment and third party services, HAZOP assessments and post-implementation (training, method setup).
March 2017 to March 2019 Grillo-Werke AG, R&D Department, Chemical Division Duisburg, Germany
Position: Research Chemist
Tasks: Study of the sulfonation of methane to methanesulfonic acid and recycling of fluorocarbons under superacid conditions; scale-up process to a pilot plant setting; handle corrosive and explosive mixtures; prepare patents and scientific publications.
March 2016 – March 2017 Hopperide Inc.; Ottawa, Canada
Position: Start-up Co-founder
Tasks: Implementation from zero-to-one of every aspect of a technological start-up; business development, software coding, financing, customer engagement, etc.
COMMENT
Core Competencies
Managing complex research projects (ideation, prioritization, execution), translating vision from business into research solutions, intellectual property drafting, pilot plant construction and operation (eg., reactors up to 4 gallons, 120 barg, and 7.5 m distillation columns).
Managing and training laboratory technicians in air-sensitive techniques, high-throughput techniques, pressure reactors, vacuum distillations, handling highly corrosive and explosive mixtures, reporting out data, and SHE trainings for nobody gets hurt policy.
Expertise in data acquisition and interpretation of homogeneous and heterogeneous catalyst characterization (X-ray diffraction, NMR, FT-IR, BET, SEM, TEM, etc), and catalytic process development and optimization (online GC, HPLC, NMR, etc).
Inventor on eight patent applications and author of eight peer-reviewed publications. Over twenty three international conference presentations.
Research Internships
Alexandre Martinez’s Research Group, ENS Lyon; France May 2015
R. Tom Baker’s Research Group, University of Ottawa September 2010 – December 2010
Tito Scaiano’s Research Group, University of Ottawa July 2010 – August 2010
Claudio Olea's Research Group, Universidad de Chile March 2009 – July 2009
Madegom S.A.; Santiago, Chile January 2009 – March 2009
Scholarships And Awards
Chemicals Global Technology Award 2022. ExxonMobil
Active Material Enterprise Award 2021. ExxonMobil
Chemical Technology – Intermediates Global Excellence Award 2020. ExxonMobil
Faculty of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies Dean’s Scholarship 2016
Second Year Teaching Assistant Award 2015 – 2016. University of Ottawa
Dr. Yu Scholarship, University of Ottawa 2015 – 2016
Lignoworks Travel Award for Paperweek. 2015. Montreal, QC
ACS Industrial and Engineering Ch
